intro: Schotia bequaertii, commonly known as the Natal umbrella tree, is a distinctive African plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, umbrella-like crown formed by its thick, spreading branches. The plant has smooth, greyish bark and produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by orange-red fruits. Schotia bequaertii is native to South Africa and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments. It is also valued for its use in traditional medicine.
